content:
User: There is an option to "Connect repository"
Attached 1 file.
- image_b26841.png

Gemini: [ACTION_TAG] Click "Connect repository": Go ahead and click the "Connect repository" button in the Cloud Build Triggers interface.
[AUTHORIZATION_TAG] Follow the Authorization Prompts: You will then be guided through a series of prompts to authorize the "Google Cloud Build GitHub App" to access your GitHub account. Follow these prompts carefully. This usually involves:
Selecting your GitHub account.
Choosing which organization or repositories Cloud Build can access. Make sure you grant access to your ai-execution-system repository.
Approving the Cloud Build GitHub App permissions.
[REPOSITORY_SELECTION_TAG] Select your Repository: After authorization, you'll likely be presented with a list of your GitHub repositories. Choose your ai-execution-system repository from this list to connect it to Cloud Build.
[REASSURANCE_TAG] You're on the right track! Using the "Connect repository" button is the correct and expected way to begin linking your GitHub repository to Cloud Build. It's the foundation for setting up the automated build and deployment pipeline.

Once you've clicked "Connect repository" and gone through the authorization flow, let me know! We can then proceed to the next steps in creating the trigger and configuring the cloudbuild.yaml file to complete the GitHub sync setup.

Gemini Apps
